trans-unit.source: Carries information specific to hit-testing points for a month calendar control

target.mrk: Carries information specific to hit-testing points for a month calendar control

trans-unit.source: Results of the hit test operation. This value will be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Results of the hit test operation.
This value will be one of the following:

target.mrk: Results of the hit test operation.
This value will be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: $MCHT_CALENDARBK - The given point was in the calendar's background

trans-unit.source: The RECT of the hit-tested location.

seg-source.mrk: The RECT of the hit-tested location.

target.mrk: The RECT of the hit-tested location.

trans-unit.source: When displaying more than one calendar, this is the offset of the calendar at the hit-tested point (0-based).

seg-source.mrk: When displaying more than one calendar, this is the offset of the calendar at the hit-tested point (0-based).

target.mrk: When displaying more than one calendar, this is the offset of the calendar at the hit-tested point (0-based).

trans-unit.source: The row number for the calendar grid that the given hit point was over. Example: If you hit-tested the 8th of a month, which is in the second week of the month, iRow will be one since the index of the row is 0-based row index.

seg-source.mrk: The row number for the calendar grid that the given hit point was over.
Example:
If you hit-tested the 8th of a month, which is in the second week of the month, iRow will be one since the index of the row is 0-based row index.

target.mrk: The row number for the calendar grid that the given hit point was over.
Example:
If you hit-tested the 8th of a month, which is in the second week of the month, iRow will be one since the index of the row is 0-based row index.

trans-unit.source: The column number for the calendar grid that the given point was over. For example, if your week starts on Sunday and the 1st of the month is Friday, hit testing the 1st will return five (5) for iCol, since Friday is in the fifth column from the beginning of the row, using a 0-based column index.

seg-source.mrk: The column number for the calendar grid that the given point was over.

For example, if your week starts on Sunday and the 1st of the month is Friday, hit testing the 1st will return five (5) for iCol, since Friday is in the fifth column from the beginning of the row, using a 0-based column index.

target.mrk: The column number for the calendar grid that the given point was over.

For example, if your week starts on Sunday and the 1st of the month is Friday, hit testing the 1st will return five (5) for iCol, since Friday is in the fifth column from the beginning of the row, using a 0-based column index.
